p: The intrarectal administration of diluted acetic acid provides an alternative method to create a chemical lesion in the mucosal epithelium that induces a transient phenotype that mimics UC. It generates diffuse colitis related to the dose of acetic acid with histopathological characteristics, such as ulcerative lesions in the distal colon or abnormality in intestinal crypts that extends to the lamina propria [ 13, 56].
